Can Non-Citizens Get Healthcare in Canada? The answer is yes, as illustrated in this article: How to Get Health Care in Canada for Non-citizens is Easy.

How can you qualify for the Ontario Health Insurance Plan?

Minimum Requirements for the OHIP

To qualify for the OHIP minimum necessities, you must meet the following criteria:

  • Live in Ontario at least 153 days of the year
  • Live in Ontario for out of 183 days after you first move to the province, and
  • Make Ontario your main home (not a secondary, holiday home, or new).

Necessary Requirements for applying:

If you have been able to meet the above criteria, you also need to meet at least 1 one of the requirements listed below to qualify for OHIP; you must meet the following basic requirements outlined below before applying for OHIP:

  • You Must Be a Canadian citizen, indigenous person, or stable resident of Canada
  • Have applied for a stable abode to the IRCC to:
  • Prove you can apply for the OHIP
  • Confirm that your demand for permanent residence in Canada has not been denied.

Have:

  • A valid Ontario work permit that has let you work full-time for at least 6 months
  • A valid Ontario work permit that is under the federal Live-in Caregiver Program
  • Be a protected person or a conventional refugee, as defined by Immigration and Refugee Canada.
  • Have a temporary resident permit (this applies for case type 86-95 only)
  • Belong to a legal religious organization (minister, priest, etc.) that will minister full-time for at least 6 months.

 How Can You Apply for the OHIP?

  • You must first book an appointment with the service Ontario centre
  • For your appointment, you must bring the following
  • A complete Ontario Health Coverage form
  • 3 original documents that prove you:
    1. You are a citizen of Ontario (permanent Resident Card or Canada Birth certificate)
    2. You have lived in Ontario ( Ontario tax Assessment or Ontario Driver’s License)
    3. Prove that you are not using another person’s identity (prove your credit card or passport).

In case you want to apply for the OHIP with children under 16 years of age:

You do not need a photo or signature on their health care; it will be signed by the parent or guardian in charge of the child.

When does Your OHIP cover you after You Successfully Apply?

If your OHIP application has been accepted, you should expect immediate coverage. Ontario waived the previous 3 months’ waiting period due to COVID-19.

Those who intend to live in Ontario can check out more details about the process, application, and OHIP at the Ministry of Ontario Health.
